t: Mark 14
The Plot to Kill Jesus
It*p was two days before the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread. The chief priests and the scribes were looking for a cunning way to arrest Jesus and kill him.
“Not during the festival,” they said, “so that there won’t be a riot among the people.”
The Anointing at Bethany

While*p he was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper, as he was reclining at the table, a woman came with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume of pure nard. She broke the jar and poured it on his head.
But some were expressing indignation to one another: “Why has this perfume been wasted?
For this perfume might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor.” And they began to scold her.
Jesus*p replied, “Leave*r her*r alone.*r Why*r are*r you*r bothering*r her?*r She*r has*r done*r a*r noble*r thing*r for*r me.*r
You*r always*r have*r the*r poor*r with*r you,*r and*r you*r can*r do*r what*r is*r good*r for*r them*r whenever*r you*r want,*r but*r you*r do*r not*r always*r have*r me.*r
She*r has*r done*r what*r she*r could;*r she*r has*r anointed*r my*r body*r in*r advance*r for*r burial.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r wherever*r the*r gospel*r is*r proclaimed*r in*r the*r whole*r world,*r what*r she*r has*r done*r will*r also*r be*r told*r in*r memory*r of*r her.”*r
Then*p Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Jesus to them.
And when they heard this, they were glad and promised to give him money. So he started looking for a good opportunity to betray him.
Preparation for Passover
On*p the first day of Unleavened Bread, when they sacrifice the Passover lamb, his disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare the Passover so that you may eat it?”
So*p he sent two of his disciples and told them, “Go*r into*r the*r city,*r and*r a*r man*r carrying*r a*r jar*r of*r water*r will*r meet*r you.*r Follow*r him.*r
Wherever*r he*r enters,*r tell*r the*r owner*r of*r the*r house,*r ‘The*r Teacher*r says,*r “Where*r is*r my*r guest*r room*r where*r I*r may*r eat*r the*r Passover*r with*r my*r disciples?”’*r
He*r will*r show*r you*r a*r large*r room*r upstairs,*r furnished*r and*r ready.*r Make*r the*r preparations*r for*r us*r there.”*r
So the disciples went out, entered the city, and found it just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
Betrayal at the Passover
When*p evening came, he arrived with the Twelve.
While they were reclining and eating, Jesus said, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r one*r of*r you*r will*r betray*r me — one*r who*r is*r eating*r with*r me.”*r
They*p began to be distressed and to say to him one by one, “Surely not I?”
He*p said to them, “It*r is*r one*r of*r the*r Twelve — the*r one*r who*r is*r dipping*r bread*r in*r the*r bowl*r with*r me.*r

For*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r go*r just*r as*r it*r is*r written*r about*r him,*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r betrayed!*r It*r would*r have*r been*r better*r for*r him*r if*r he*r had*r not*r been*r born.”*r
The First Lord’s Supper
As*p they were eating, he took bread, blessed and broke it, gave it to them, and said, “Take*r it;*r this*r is*r my*r body.”*r
Then he took a cup, and after giving thanks, he gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
He said to them, “This*r is*r my*r blood*r of*r the*r covenant,*r which*r is*r poured*r out*r for*r many.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r I*r will*r no*r longer*r drink*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine*r until*r that*r day*r when*r I*r drink*r it*r new*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
After*p singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Peter’s Denial Predicted
Then*p Jesus said to them, “All*r of*r you*r will*r fall*r away,*r because*r it*r is*r written:*r I*irpn will*ir strike*ir the*ir shepherd,*ir and*irln the*ir sheep*ir will*ir be*ir scattered.*ir
But*rp after*r I*r have*r risen,*r I*r will*r go*r ahead*r of*r you*r to*r Galilee.”*r
Peter*p told him, “Even if everyone falls away, I will not.”
“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,”*r Jesus said to him, “today,*r this*r very*r night,*r before*r the*r rooster*r crows*r twice,*r you*r will*r deny*r me*r three*r times.”*r
But*p he kept insisting, “If I have to die with you, I will never deny you.” And they all said the same thing.
The Prayer in the Garden
Then*p they came to a place named Gethsemane, and he told his disciples, “Sit*r here*r while*r I*r pray.”*r
He took Peter, James, and John with him, and he began to be deeply distressed and troubled.
He said to them, “I*r am*r deeply*r grieved*r to*r the*r point*r of*r death.*r Remain*r here*r and*r stay*r awake.”*r
He went a little farther, fell to the ground, and prayed that if it were possible, the hour might pass from him.
And he said, “Abba,*br Father!*r All*r things*r are*r possible*r for*r you.*r Take*r this*r cup*r away*r from*r me.*r Nevertheless,*r not*r what*r I*r will,*r but*r what*r you*r will.”*r
Then he came and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “Simon,*r are*r you*r sleeping?*r Couldn’t*r you*r stay*r awake*r one*r hour?*r
Stay*r awake*r and*r pray*r so*r that*r you*r won’t*r enter*r into*r temptation.*r The*r spirit*r is*r willing,*r but*r the*r flesh*r is*r weak.”*r
Once again he went away and prayed, saying the same thing.
And again he came and found them sleeping, because they could not keep their eyes open. They did not know what to say to him.

Then he came a third time and said to them, “Are*r you*r still*r sleeping*r and*r resting?*r Enough!*r The*r time*r has*r come.*r See,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinners.*r
Get*r up;*r let’s*r go.*r See,*r my*r betrayer*r is*r near.”*r
Judas’s Betrayal of Jesus
While*p he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, suddenly arrived. With him was a mob, with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.
His betrayer had given them a signal. “The one I kiss,” he said, “he’s the one; arrest him and take him away under guard.”
So when he came, immediately he went up to Jesus and said, “Rabbi!” and kissed him.
They took hold of him and arrested him.
One of those who stood by drew his sword, struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his ear.
Jesus*p said to them, “Have*r you*r come*r out*r with*r swords*r and*r clubs,*r as*r if*r I*r were*r a*r criminal,*r to*r capture*r me?*r
Every*r day*r I*r was*r among*r you,*r teaching*r in*r the*r temple,*r and*r you*r didn’t*r arrest*r me.*r But*r the*r Scriptures*r must*r be*r fulfilled.”*r
Then*p they all deserted him and ran away.
Now a certain young man, wearing nothing but a linen cloth, was following him. They caught hold of him,
but he left the linen cloth behind and ran away naked.
Jesus Faces the Sanhedrin
They*p led Jesus away to the high priest, and all the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes assembled.
Peter followed him at a distance, right into the high priest’s courtyard. He was sitting with the servants, warming himself by the fire.
The*p chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for testimony against Jesus to put him to death, but they could not find any.
For many were giving false testimony against him, and the testimonies did not agree.
Some stood up and gave false testimony against him, stating,
“We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with human hands, and in three days I will build another not made by hands.’”
Yet their testimony did not agree even on this.
Then*p the high priest stood up before them all and questioned Jesus, “Don’t you have an answer to what these men are testifying against you?”
But he kept silent and did not answer. Again the high priest questioned him, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”
“I*rp am,”*r said Jesus, “and*r you*r will*r see*r the*ir Son*ir of*ir Man*ir seated*ir at*ir the*ir right*ir hand*ir of*ir Power*ir and*ir coming*ir with*ir the*ir clouds*ir of*ir heaven.”*ir
Then*p the high priest tore his robes and said, “Why do we still need witnesses?
You have heard the blasphemy. What is your decision?” They all condemned him as deserving death.
Then*p some began to spit on him, to blindfold him, and to beat him, saying, “Prophesy!” The temple servants also took him and slapped him.
Peter Denies His Lord
While*p Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the high priest’s maidservants came.
When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You also were with Jesus, the man from Nazareth.”
But*p he denied it: “I don’t know or understand what you’re talking about.” Then he went out to the entryway, and a rooster crowed.
When*p the maidservant saw him again, she began to tell those standing nearby, “This man is one of them.”
But*p again he denied it. After a little while those standing there said to Peter again, “You certainly are one of them, since you’re also a Galilean.”
Then*p he started to curse and swear, “I don’t know this man you’re talking about!”

Immediately*p a rooster crowed a second time, and Peter remembered when Jesus had spoken the word to him, “Before*r the*r rooster*r crows*r twice,*r you*r will*r deny*r me*r three*r times.”*r And he broke down and wept.
